intro: Adenophora nikoensis var. persicaria, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
